New Records: Roston Chase scored 42 not out, the highest score in the match.
West Indies reached 137 for 5 in 19 overs, their target.
The sixth-wicket partnership of 40 runs between Roston Chase and Andre Russell lasted just three overs.
Key Match Events: Papua New Guinea batted first and scored 136 for 8 in 20 overs.
West Indies stuttered to 97 for 5 with four overs left before Roston Chase and Andre Russell's partnership turned the game.
Chase took a brilliant catch at backward point to dismiss PNG captain Assad Vala.
The match was won by West Indies with an over to spare.
Pre-Game Insights: PNG was considered a potential upset candidate despite their inexperience in the tournament.
West Indies were expected to dominate but struggled initially.
Post-Match Reflections: Roston Chase was named Man of the Match for his crucial innings.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell acknowledged the team's need to improve in all aspects of the game.
Papua New Guinea captain Assad Vala praised the team's effort and looked forward to future matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Guyana National Stadium in Providence.
It was Papua New Guinea's second appearance in a T20 World Cup, having lost all three matches in their debut in 2021.
